titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Communications Workers of America, Local 1103 Records WAG.130
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Nicole Greenhouse

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-07-08T15:46-0400

change.item: Edited by Heather Mulliner to reflect updated administrative information.

did.unittitle: Communications Workers of America, Local 1103 Records

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

did.abstract: Communications Workers of America, Local 1103 represents telecommunication workers in Westerchester and Putnam counties. The collection contains materials from the 1989 campaign.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Robert McCracken, President of CWA Local 1103, sent a gift of the record of the Communications Workers of America, Local 1103 in 1994. The accession number associated with this gift is 1987.013.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Communications Workers of America, Local 1103 received its charter on May 12, 1961 with 900 members. By the 1990s, the union had grown to representing over 2000 New York telephone workers in Westchester and Putnam counties. Daniel Keenan was president from 1964-1979 and Robert McCracken was president from 1989-2007. As of this writing (2014) Kevin Sheil is president of the union.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains materials related to the 1989 union elections and lawsuits related to the union.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection has not been arranged by an archivist.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright (and related rights to publicity and privacy) to materials in this collection created by the Communications Workers of America, Local 1103 are held by Local 1103, CWA. Permission to publish or reproduce materials to which the union holds copyright must be secured from the copyright holder. Please contact the Tamiment Library for assistance with contacting Local 1103, CWA.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: In 2014, an inventory was added and the archived websites were added as a series.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Communications Workers of America, Local 1103 Records; WAG 130; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The website contains their newsletter, the Eagle, event listings, union news, strikes, contracts, agreements, and other information on benefits.
